intro: Tournefortia conocarpa, commonly known as the Mexican turpentine tree, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, simple leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in sandy or limestone soils. The tree is valued for its hard wood and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
